item.title: Report X-2025061240
item.description:
Report X-2025061240

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-16
  • City: EAGAN
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Supervisor, called Safety to report a spill involving trailer UN1219, ISOPROPANOL, Class 3, PG II, ERG 129 (Alcohol Isopropyl). Upon inspection, Employee noted that the spill had already dried. He observed that two boxes containing 1-gallon pails appeared to have been crushed due to the weight of a skid and the way it was loaded.~~Employee confirmed that there was no active spill in the trailer and that any liquid had already evaporated, consistent with the properties of alcohol. He placed the damaged containers and the crushed boxes into a recovery drum. He also stated that he would label the drum with the PRO number and contact ABF Safety Disposals for proper handling.~

item.title: Report X-2025052227
item.description:
Report X-2025052227

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-23
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HAZ-MAT PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP ON 5/22/25, AT 11:40 PM. THE PACKAGE CAME FROM DOOR 36, ON THE C-UNLOAD. IN THE DMP PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN ONE, 5 GALLON METAL, CLOSED HEAD PAIL, WHICH CONTAINED DENCO NON-CHLOR. BRAKE PARTS CLEANER, BEING SHIPPED AS A FLAMMABLE HAZ-MAT PACKAGE (UN1993, FLAMMABLE LIQUIDS, N.O.S., (ACETONE, HEPTANE), 3, II,1, STEEL PAIL X 5 GALLON). THE METAL PAIL HAD BEEN BADLY DENTED INSIDE ITS CARTON AT SOMEPOINT WHCH ALLOWED A LARGE AMOUNT OF THE ACETONE, HEPTANE MIXTURE TO LEAK ONTO THE OUTSIDE CARTON. ALL MATERIAL WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-21
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A HAZMAT AUDITOR CAME BY THE DMP AND SAID THERE WAS A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THEIR TRAM. THEY POINTED OUT A PACKAGE WITH A CLASS 8 HAZARD DIAMOND LABEL THAT WAS LEAKING A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID FROM ONE OF THE BOTTOM CORNERS OF THE BOX. INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTETNS SHOWED A 1 GAL CONTAINER THAT WAS LEAKING FROM THE SEAM IN THE SIDE OF THE CONTAINER.

item.title: Report X-2025051619
item.description:
Report X-2025051619

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-16
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO ONE DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE FROM GERMANY THAT WAS LEAKING A LIQUID. THE OUTER PACKAGE WAS DECLARED AS UN1170, ETHANOL SOLUTION WITH A CLASS 3 DIAMOND LABEL AND SHIPPERS DECLARATION FOR DANGEROUS GOODS. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY IN GERMANY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWENTY-FIVE INNER BOTTLES OF CHEMAGIC BINDING BUFFER BLOOD WITH ONE LEAKING THE ENTIRE ONE LITER AMOUNT FROM WHAT APPEARS TO BE A DEFECTIVE CLOSURE. EACH INNER BOTTLE IS ONE LITER CAPACITY. THE PACKAGE AND ENTIRE CONTENTS HAVE BEEN DISPOSED OF PER NORMAL DISPOSAL PROCEDURES.

  • Description: On May 11th a drum was found that was marked with UN3082, Environmentally hazardous substances, 9, III. The package was discovered at the origin station and was noticed to be leaking prior to inspection. The package was not labeled as DG, and did not have a shipper's declaration of dangerous goods with it. The spill was cleaned up and held pending investigation by the FAA.

item.title: Report E-2025050444
item.description:
Report E-2025050444

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-22
  • City: SOUTH SAINT PAUL
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This was staged at the tankwash in South Saint Paul. The driver who came in to pick it up found it leaking slowly from the bleeder valve coming off of the main discharge valve. Upon closer inspection the cap that goes over the bleeder valve was deteriorated from toploading a corrosive product too many times combined with the fact that the cap doesn't appear to be stainless like the rest of the assembly. 1-2 ounce leaked on the ground. The driver was able to clean it up with absorbants.
